content:
Ogilvy is seeking a Senior Manager, Compensation to join their growing North America Reward team.  The individual plays a key role in the development and administration of compensation and reward programs that attract, motivate, and retain critical talent in our organization. The ideal candidate will have experience working in a large, complex organization.   
 
This role reports to the Head of Reward, Americas and will be based in New York with in office expectation of 3 days per week.
 
 RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Conduct analysis and provide insights to inform decisions on rewards strategy, plan design and development
Research and analyze market practices through participation in and analysis of external benchmarking data to support North America business
Act as internal consultant to our HR People Partners to address reward questions, issues and recommend solutions leveraging best practices and insights
Support new hire process by providing job leveling, benchmarking roles and insights on internal equity
Lead counteroffer process with benchmarking, seek approvals as needed generate and offer letters
Conduct FLSA evaluations, and audits to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements
Participate in and support our evolving pay for performance culture by using advanced Excel skills to provide analysis and manage the bonus, long term incentive and semi-annual salary increase processes
Prepare, analysis and coordination of materials for submissions to corporate parent
Partner with Finance to track compensation budgets and data requests
Manage quarterly vesting process of stock option plan
Manage and support the introduction and maintenance of a global job architecture for North America in partnership with other Op Cos including developing and maintaining salary ranges and coordinating across businesses
Lead and coordination the review of monthly Promotions to Vacancy requests
Participate in the design and implementation compensation technology such as Workday
Participate in ad hoc Rewards projects that enhance the quality of data, plan designs and employee experience

REQUIRED SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND ABILITIES: 

7+ years of experience as a Compensation Analyst/Manager (base, bonus, and long-term incentive)


Understanding of agency skills sets (advertising, creative, media, analytics, planning)
HR systems such as ADP, Workday and SAP including reporting and analytics
Detail oriented with strong organizational and follow through skills
Strong partnering skills and collaboration mindset
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Proactive, enthusiastic problem solver
Demonstrable experience managing multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously
Comfortable with ambiguity
Excellent data reporting and analysis skills
Thrive in a fast-paced environment

We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
